title: All Types Dialog Displays Obfuscated Classes
description: When using JDK 1.4, the 'All Types' dialog displays obfuscated classes such as 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd', etc.
OB: The 'All Types' dialog prominently showcases obfuscated classes like 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd', etc., making it challenging to discern actual class names.
EB: Obfuscated classes should appear less prominently or be clearly distinguished from the actual class names in the 'All Types' dialog.
SR:
1. Open the 'All Types' dialog in JDK 1.4.
2. Notice how obfuscated classes 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd', etc., are displayed.
3. Attempt to differentiate between obfuscated and non-obfuscated class names within the dialog.
